snippet: In the byzantine world of N.F.L. contracts and labor relations, Jason Pierre-Paul and the Giants find themselves uncomfortable partners in a bizarre dance that is part standoff and part negotiation.
abstract: Absence of New York Giants defensive end Jason Pierre-Paul from team's training camp, and seemingly total lack of information regarding his whereabouts, points to oddity inherent in convoluted world of contracts and labor relations in NFL; Pierre-Paul has not re-signed with Giants, but due to rules of contracts, he is allowed to remain on team; he has not shown up for training and refuses to see team doctors after having had index finger amputated following fireworks-related injury on July 4.
lead_paragraph: In the byzantine world of N.F.L. contracts and labor relations, Jason Pierre-Paul and the Giants find themselves uncomfortable partners in a bizarre dance that is part standoff and part negotiation.

headline.main: Jason Pierre-Paul Is Talk of Giants Training Camp. And He Isn’t Even There.
headline.print_headline: The Curious Case of a Contract, a Giant and a Missing Finger
